item.title: Juufuutei Raden’s Guide for Pixel Museum coming to PS4 on December 10, Xbox Series and Xbox One later
item.content:encoded:
• PS4
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Currently available for Switch and PC.

Jupiter Corporation will release pixel puzzle game Juufuutei Raden’s Guide for Pixel Museum for PlayStation 4 on December 10 for $19.99 / £16.99 / €19.99, followed by Xbox Series and Xbox One at a later date, the developer announced.

Juufuutei Raden’s Guide for Pixel Museum first launched for Switch and PC via Steam on June 5. The Switch version is titled Picross: Juufuutei Raden’s Guide for Pixel Museum. The PC version will also be made available via Microsoft Store when the game launches for Xbox consoles.

To celebrate the launch of the PlayStation 4 version, the PlayStation 4 and Switch versions of Juufuutei Raden’s Guide for Pixel Museum will be on sale at a 30 percent-off discount price from December 10 to 24, and the PC version from December 10 to January 5. On PlayStation 4, only PlayStation Plus subscribers will be eligible for the discount.

Here is an overview of the game, via Jupiter Corporation:

About

Solve the puzzle and complete the art!

Supervised by Juufuutei Raden of the unit ReGLOSS—part of the VTuber group hololive DEV_IS under the umbrella of hololive production! It’s a “Pixel Puzzle” that allows you to experience art and culture.

You Can Enjoy Dot Art and Curator Raden’s Commentary!

The puzzle is a “Pixel Puzzle” where the illustration is completed by solving it. The main puzzles are based on themes related to arts, crafts, and culture. In addition to enjoying the completed “Dot Art,” you can also enjoy explanations of artworks with voice commentary by Curator Raden.

Play at Your Own Pace With “Pixel Puzzle”

This is a puzzle with simple rules that can be solved by using the vertical and horizontal numbers as clues. With a detailed tutorial, even beginners can easily enjoy the puzzles. Various assist functions are implemented to ensure smooth gameplay. (The assist function can also be turned off.)

Types and Number of Puzzles

In addition to arts and crafts, it will also includes many puzzles related to Juufuutei Raden! You can also enjoy the illustrated puzzles, reimagined from previous streamed content.

  • A wide range of puzzle sizes are available, from “5×5” to “40×30.”
  • 150 standard pixel puzzles, where each puzzle completes a single illustration.
  • 10 special puzzles, where multiple puzzles come together to create a large illustration.
  • The total number of puzzles is over 300, offering a generous volume!

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: Co-op ‘bullet-heaven’ first-person shooter POSTAL: Bullet Paradise announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch

Play as multiple Dudes from across the POSTAL series.

Publisher Running With Scissors and developer Goonswarm Games have announced POSTAL: Bullet Paradise, a cooperative online play-supported “bullet-heaven” first-person shooter. It will launch first for PC, Mac, and Linux via Steam in Q3 2026 for $19.99, followed by PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch at a later date.

“POSTAL: Bullet Paradise is all about releasing the essence of POSTAL and its signature gallows humor into an over-the-top and highly replayable package,” said Goonswarm Games CEO Artem Korovkin in a press release. “Equal parts irreverent and action-packed, we’re thrilled to partner with Running With Scissors to bring this dystopian slice of Paradise to life.”

Running With Scissors founder Vince Desi added, “No way in Hell Mike J is going to Heaven. But he’s definitely gunning for POSTAL: Bullet Paradise next year.”

  • ❮
  • ❯

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

POSTAL: Bullet Paradise throws the Dude straight into the Shitty Future, a world where every robot, psycho, mutant, and corporate goon wants you very, very dead. Good news: you don’t care. Even better news: there’s plenty of junk lying around that can be turned into guns, bombs, or whatever else makes things explode.

This is a bullet-heaven shooter with online cooperative play, an arsenal of improvised weapons, and more psychos than the Dude has unpaid parking tickets. Pick your favorite Dude from across the POSTAL multiverse and carve your way through waves of chaos, upgrades, and stupidly dangerous power fantasy moments.

Key Features

  • Play as Multiple Dudes – Choose from iconic versions of the POSTAL Dude from across the entire series. Each one has unique stats, perks, and attitude problems.
  • Online Cooperative Carnage – Team up with friends (or other unstable strangers) to survive the endless storm of enemies. Revive each other, stack builds, and ruin the future together.
  • Bullet-Heaven Gameplay – Hundreds of enemies on screen. Thousands of projectiles. Zero shame. Movement and build choices matter… mostly because everything is trying to erase you.
  • DIY Arsenal – Trash becomes firepower. Upgrade weird weapons, stack absurd modifiers, and turn broken scraps into overpowered monstrosities.
  • The Shitty Future – A dystopian world filled with psycho, corporate cultists, malfunctioning robots, and way too much surveillance. If it moves, it probably wants to kill you.
  • Progression That Actually Feels Good – Unlock new Dudes and other well-known POSTAL characters, weapons, abilities, and synergies as you survive longer. Die horribly, come back stronger.
  • Multiverse Flavor – POSTAL 1, 2, 3, 4, Brain Damaged… they’re all here. Easter eggs, references, and familiar faces for fans who know the chaos by heart.
  • Stupid Jokes, Smart Explosions – POSTAL-style humor and a lot of things blowing up. Sometimes both at once.

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.

item.title: Hello Kitty Skyland launches in Early Access on December 22
item.content:encoded:
• Quest

Free-to-play social virtual reality game dated.

Free-to-play social virtual reality game Hello Kitty Skyland will launch in Early Access for Quest 2 and Quest 3 via Meta Store on December 22, developer Thirdverse announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via Thirdverse:

Early Access Overview

In Early Access, players will gain access to the central online lobby area of SKYLAND and experience core content, including the multiplayer competitive race game, “Sky Dash.”

The avatar dress-up system will also feature a variety of original outfits, as well as limited-time avatar costumes themed around Hello Kitty, Kuromi, and My Melody, allowing players to express themselves in unique and charming ways.

During the Early Access period, the development team will gather player feedback and continue adding content toward the full release.

About the Game

Hello Kitty Skyland is a new social virtual reality game set in a virtual world called SKYLAND, where Sanrio characters appear. Players from around the globe can gather and enjoy a variety of activities and social interactions.

In addition to immersive encounters with Sanrio characters in VR, the game includes full-body multiplayer activities, avatar decoration features, and many other virtual reality-native experiences.

Players can enjoy a wide range of content through customization, cooperation, and discovery.

item.title: Co-op action RPG Serpent’s Gaze announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
Feeble Minds, a new studio founded by former Coffee Stain Studio founders, has announced Serpent’s Gaze, a cooperative action RPG that “blends the tactical combat and epic bosses of a Soulslike with the power creeping build-creation of roguelikes.” A demo is available now for PC via Steam.

“We’re really excited to officially unveil our studio to the world, give you a first look at our new game, Serpent’s Gaze, and let you try it out right away with our demo,” said Feeble Minds CEO Jannik Reuterberg in a press release. “At Feeble Minds, we have a mix of experienced people who worked on some big titles at places like Coffee Stain and Paradox, alongside fresh new talent. In that image, we are working hard to create a rich world that combines the best elements of games we love with new ideas to create something new and amazing. We can’t wait to hear your feedback on the demo and share more as we continue to work on the game!”

  • ❮
  • ❯

Here is an overview of the game, via Feeble Minds:

About

Serpent’s Gaze is a punishing one-to-four-player cooperative third-person action game where you fight tough enemies and relentless bosses, all while uncovering the secrets of an ancient desert.

Serpent’s Gaze features handcrafted levels, with no procedural generation, best enjoyed in up to four-player cooperative play, though the game can also be played in single-player. Every run is unique thanks to a “Curse” system that applies stacking difficulty modifiers to your runs, from invading enemies, to minibosses that will hunt you down. Construct powerful builds on each run to overcome the many challenges you will face.

You play as a scion—given life by the withering tree god Magnolia, with the sole purpose of vanquishing the opposing gods and usurpers who currently rule the lands. There is only one path towards that goal—violence. But you choose how to tread that path, and along the way you’ll learn more about the secrets of the desert and the truth behind your patron in a story that subtly unfolds as you play.

Key Features

  • Soulslike Combat With a Roguelike Twist – Choose your favorite weapon and fight tough enemies in heavy, tactical combat, with a plethora of different upgrade possibilities. Fight your way through handcrafted levels, and face the bosses—as many times as you need.
  • Play as a Team, or Face the Challenges Alone – With support for up to 4 players, you can face the challenges of the world together with your teammates, or play at your own pace alone.
  • Gather Blessings and Choose Your Playstyle – As you progress through levels, you find upgrades along the way—blessings from strange deities, gifts from your patron and strange relics to utilize in your pilgrimage. Choose wisely and explore endless builds and strategies.
  • Get Cursed by the Gods, and Adapt to New Challenges – The Curse system introduces random variables every run—everything from minibosses hunting you, to environmental hazards that keep new runs fresh and challenging. The Awareness system brings even more challenges, making each successful run progressively harder.
  • Explore an Ancient Desert and Its Mysteries – Battle through imposing environments inhabited by different factions. The desert and ruins belong to the nomadic Majin, while the city with its cathedrals is inhabited by the proud Attar’Esh.
  • Uncover the Intent of Your Creator – You are a scion—brought to life by the withering tree god Magnolia, with the sole purpose of vanquishing the opposing gods and usurpers who currently rule the lands. There is only one way to make the desert bloom again—violence.

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.
